title: Hook inside loop
explanation: Hooks must be called at the top level, not inside loops, conditions, or nested functions.

title: UseEffect dependency array
explanation: Empty dependency array ensures effect runs only on mount (and unmount for cleanup).

title: Mutating state directly
explanation: State should not be mutated directly. Use setState with a new object or functional update.

title: Class component state
explanation: Valid class component syntax.

title: Missing key in list
explanation: Each child in a list should have a unique 'key' prop.

title: Fragment syntax
explanation: Short syntax for Fragments is valid.

title: UseState async
explanation: State updates are asynchronous (batched). Console log will likely show the old value.

title: Context vs Props
codeSnippet:
const C = createContext();
// Context helps avoid prop drilling?
explanation: Context is designed to share data without passing props manually at every level.

title: Class instead of className
explanation: In JSX, use 'className' instead of 'class'.

title: Ref mutable
explanation: Updating a ref does not trigger a re-render.

title: Hook condition
explanation: Hooks must be called in the exact same order on every render. No conditionals.

title: PureComponent shallow comparison
codeSnippet:
class C extends React.PureComponent {}
// Automatically implements shouldComponentUpdate?
explanation: PureComponent implements a shallow prop and state comparison.

title: Rendering object directly
explanation: Objects are not valid as a React child (found: object with keys {name}). Use strings or numbers.

title: Custom hook name
codeSnippet:
function useMyHook() { return useState(0); }
// Valid name?
explanation: Custom hooks should start with 'use'.

title: SetState in render
explanation: Calling setState during render causes an infinite loop.

title: Memo HOC
codeSnippet:
const MyComponent = React.memo(props => <div />);
// Skips re-render if props unchanged?
explanation: React.memo prevents re-renders if props are shallowly equal.

title: Adjacent JSX elements
explanation: Adjacent JSX elements must be wrapped in an enclosing tag (like a Fragment).

title: Portals
codeSnippet:
createPortal(<Child />, document.body);
// Renders outside parent DOM hierarchy?
explanation: Portals render children into a different part of the DOM tree.

title: Effect missing dependency
explanation: Effect uses 'id' but it's not in the dependency array. It will be stale if id changes.

title: Strict Mode double render
explanation: Strict Mode intentionally double-invokes rendering to detect side effects.

title: Ref initial null
explanation: Possible null reference access. Check if ref.current is not null before accessing.

title: Lazy loading
codeSnippet:
const C = React.lazy(() => import('./C'));
// Requires Suspense?
explanation: Lazy components typically need a Suspense boundary.

title: String ref legacy
explanation: String refs are deprecated. Use callback refs or createRef.

title: Controlled input
explanation: Value is controlled by state.

title: Function as child error
explanation: Functions are not valid as direct React children. Did you mean to call it?

title: HTMLFor attribute
explanation: Use htmlFor in JSX instead of for.

title: Cleanup function return
explanation: Effect cleanup must be a function. 'fetchData()' returns a Promise, which React interprets as a cleanup function but fails or warns.

title: Prop children
explanation: props.children allows component composition.

title: Unclosed tag
explanation: JSX tags must be closed (e.g., <input />).

title: DangerouslySetInnerHTML
explanation: Valid prop for inserting raw HTML (use with caution).

title: Derived state anti-pattern
explanation: State initialized from props doesn't update when props change. Need effect to sync or use key to reset.

title: Callback ref
codeSnippet:
<div ref={node => console.log(node)} />
// Called on mount and unmount (with null)?
explanation: Callback refs are called when the node is attached or detached.

title: UseCallback missing dependency
explanation: 'id' is missing from useCallback dependencies. Closure will capture initial id.

title: Context types legacy
explanation: Legacy Context API syntax (deprecated but existed).

title: Wrong style prop
explanation: The 'style' prop expects a mapping from style properties to values, not a string.

title: ForwardRef
explanation: forwardRef allows passing refs to child components.

title: Void tag children
explanation: Void elements like cannot have children.

title: Hooks naming collision
explanation: Duplicate declaration of 'count'.

title: UseLayoutEffect ssr mismatch
explanation: useLayoutEffect causes a warning on the server because it cannot run. Use useEffect or checking environment.

title: React Create Element
explanation: JSX compiles to React.createElement calls.

title: Return multiple elements
explanation: Components must return a single root element (or Fragment).

title: Prop types
explanation: PropTypes allow runtime prop validation.

title: Async useEffect callback
explanation: Effect callback cannot be async because it returns a Promise, not a cleanup function.

title: Batching updates
explanation: React 18 batches state updates automatically in promises/timeouts too.

title: Ref value render access
explanation: Reading ref.current during render is unsafe (updates won't trigger re-render, tearing risk). Use state for renderable data.

title: UseMemo return
codeSnippet:
const val = useMemo(() => compute(), [dep]);
// Returns memoized value?
explanation: useMemo caches the return value of the function.

title: Duplicate keys
explanation: Keys must be unique among siblings.

title: Global state imports
explanation: Syntactically valid, but reading external mutable state without subscriptions is poor practice (won't update).

title: Missing return in component
explanation: Components must return JSX (or null/false). Undefined causes an error.

title: Stale closure in effect
explanation: 'count' will be stale (0) inside setInterval because dependency array is empty. Use function update or add 'count' (which resets timer).

title: Functional state update
codeSnippet:
setCount(c => c + 1);
// Safe against stale closures?
explanation: Functional updates receive the most recent state value.

title: Context provider missing value
explanation: Provider must have a 'value' prop.

title: Lazy state init
codeSnippet:
const [s] = useState(() => expensive());
// Runs expensive() only on mount?
explanation: Lazy initialization function runs only on the initial render.

title: UseEffect async void
explanation: Effect callback cannot be async. Either wrap in IIFE or define internal async function.

title: Key index anti-pattern
codeSnippet:
{items.map((item, index) =>
  • {item}
    • )} // Safe for reordered lists?
explanation: Using index as keys can cause issues with component state if list order changes.

title: Prop mutation
explanation: Props are read-only.

title: Fragment key
explanation: Fragments can have 'key' props (but not other attributes).

title: Ref access in render
explanation: Writing to ref.current during render is a side effect. Do it in useEffect or event handlers.

title: Default props function
codeSnippet:
function C({ x = 1 }) { return x; }
// Standard way to default props in function components?
explanation: Default parameter syntax is the recommended way for function components.

title: Hook call nested
explanation: Hooks cannot be called inside nested functions.

title: UseReducer vs UseState
codeSnippet:
const [state, dispatch] = useReducer(reducer, init);
// Better for complex state logic?
explanation: useReducer is preferred for complex state logic or next state depending on previous.

title: Infinite loop effect
explanation: Updating state 'count' triggers render, which runs effect, which updates 'count'... Infinite loop.

title: Context value object
codeSnippet:
<Ctx.Provider value={{ a: 1 }}>
// Triggers consumers on every parent render?
explanation: Creating a new object for 'value' on every render causes all consumers to re-render.

title: Method define in render
explanation:
Defining functions inside render is fine functionally but creates new reference every time. Rarely an error unless causing memo breaks. 
Wait, this is an 'error spotting' task. Is this strictly an error? No. 
Error: `onClick={handleClick()}` (calling execution).

title: Event handler execution
explanation: Event handler should be passed as a function, not the result of calling it (unless it returns a function). 'api()' executes on render.

title: Synthetic Events
explanation: React wraps native events in SyntheticEvent wrappers.

title: Spread props overwrite
explanation: If 'props' contains 'className', it will overwrite 'red'. Usually spread comes first to allow explicit overrides.

title: Keys collision siblings
explanation: Keys must be unique among siblings.

title: UseRef causes re-render
explanation: Updating a ref does NOT trigger a re-render. User likely expects a UI update.

title: Custom hook dependency
explanation: Custom hooks should include dependencies in their internal effects.

title: Invalid hook call class
explanation: Hooks cannot be used inside class components.

title: SetState callback
codeSnippet:
this.setState({ x: 1 }, () => console.log('Done'));
// Callback runs after updated?
explanation: Class setState accepts a callback that runs after state update and render.

title: Object as child
explanation: Cannot render object directly.

title: ForwardRef prop
codeSnippet:
<Child ref={r} />
// Only works if Child uses forwardRef (if functional)?
explanation: Function components cannot be given refs unless wrapped in forwardRef.

title: Missing prop type
explanation: Potential runtime error if 'label' is undefined/null. Should use default or check.

title: Context consumer
explanation: Consumer component using render prop is valid.

title: Return undefined
explanation: Returning undefined from a component is invalid (error). Return null to render nothing.

title: Effect return cleanup
explanation: Returning a function handles cleanup.

title: Ref string legacy 2
explanation: String refs are deprecated.

title: Suspense boundary
explanation: Suspense handles loading states for generic async components (like lazy).

title: Boolean as child
explanation:
This renders nothing. Not an error, but usually not intended if expecting text. Actually boolean/null/undefined render nothing. It's valid. Error: `return
{ {a:1} }
`.

title: Duplicate prop
explanation: Passing the same prop twice. The second one 'b' wins, but usually a bug.

title: Concurrent Input
explanation: Passing null/undefined to value makes input uncontrolled.

title: SetState stale closure 2
explanation: Closure captures 'count'. Multiple clicks result in same count. Use functional update.

title: PureComponent state
explanation: PureComponent only shallow compares props/state. Nested mutations won't trigger render.

title: UseEffect setState loop
explanation: Effect with no dependency array runs on every render, and triggers a new render. Infinite loop.

title: SyntheticEvent pool
explanation: Event pooling was removed in React 17.

title: Invalid JSX comment
explanation: Comments in JSX children must be wrapped in braces `{/* ... */}`. This renders as text.

title: Server component async
explanation: Server Components can be async.

title: Invalid hook name start
explanation: Hooks can only be called inside the body of a function component or another custom hook (must start with 'use'). 'checkUser' is a regular function?

title: UseId hook
explanation: useId generates unique IDs safe for SSR.

title: Missing provider
codeSnippet:
const val = useContext(Ctx);
// Returns undefined if no provider?
explanation:
Not an error, returns default value. 
Error: `const [x, y] = useContext(Ctx)` (returns value, not tuple, unless context is tuple).

title: Hook conditional return
explanation: Hooks must be called before any early returns.

title: Key prop access
explanation: 'key' and 'ref' are not passed as props to the component.

title: UseMemo void return
explanation: Memo function should return a value. Returns undefined here.

title: FlushSync
codeSnippet:
flushSync(() => setCount(1));
// Forces synchronous DOM update?
explanation: flushSync forces React to flush updates synchronously.

title: SetState mutation
explanation: Mutating state object and passing same reference to setState may result in bail-out (no render).

title: Default export component
explanation: Anonymous default export component is valid (though debugging is harder).

title: Child as hook arg
explanation: useEffect expects a function, not a React element.

title: UseTransition
explanation: Standard hook for non-blocking updates.

title: Unrecognized prop warning
explanation: Passing non-standard props to DOM elements causes a warning (in React 15/16/strict). React 16+ allows custom attributes if lowercase? Yes, but casing matters. `myProp` (camelCase) usually warned unless `data-`.

title: Style unitless number
explanation: React appends 'px' to unitless numbers for certain style properties.

title: UseImperativeHandle missing forwardRef
explanation: Component must be wrapped in forwardRef to receive 'ref' as the second argument.

title: Error Boundary Hooks
explanation: There is no Hook equivalent for componentDidCatch yet. Error Boundaries must be class components.

title: Context provider value change
explanation: Not strictly an error, but key performance issue. Passing a new object literal `{{x:1}}` causes all consumers to re-render on every App render. Memoize it.

title: Portal Event Bubbling
codeSnippet:
{createPortal(
// Clicks on button bubble to div?
explanation: Events enacted in a Portal bubble up effectively through the React tree, regardless of DOM location.

title: UseEffect cleanup async
explanation: Cleanup function cannot be async (React expects a void/undefined return, not a Promise).

title: React.memo default identifier
codeSnippet:
const C = React.memo(props => <div />);
// C.displayName is automatically set?
explanation: React devtools usually infer it, but 'displayName' is not automatically set on the returned component unless explicitly defined.

title: Key on component inside map
explanation: Key should be on the outermost element returned by map callback (the Fragment here). <Fragment key={...}>.

title: UseLayoutEffect vs UseEffect
explanation: useLayoutEffect fires synchronously after DOM mutations but before paint.

title: Hook outside component
codeSnippet:
const [state, setState] = useState(0);
function App() { return null; }
explanation: Hooks must be called inside a component.

title: Strict Mode side effects
explanation: In React 18 Strict Mode dev, effects allow mount->unmount->mount sequence to stress test cleanup.

title: Render prop children
explanation:
Valid syntax for render props. Not an error. 
Error: `function C({children}) { return children(); }` call when children is not a function.

title: Render prop children invalid
codeSnippet:
function C({ children }) { return children(); }
// Usage: <C>Text</C>
explanation: If 'children' is 'Text' (string), calling it throws error. Should check type.

title: Batching inside timeouts
explanation: React 18 enables automatic batching for promises, setTimeouts, etc.

title: Invalid ref attached
explanation: Should pass the ref object itself `ref={ref}`, not `ref.current`.

title: UseDebugValue
explanation: Used in custom hooks to display a label in React DevTools.

title: Direct DOM manipulation
explanation: Side effects like DOM manipulation should happen in useEffect, not render body.

title: Context multi-consumers
codeSnippet:
const val = useContext(Ctx);
// Multiple components can consume same context?
explanation: Yes, Context is designed for one-to-many state distribution.

title: UseState initializer side effect
explanation: State initializer should be pure. Writing to localStorage here is a side effect during render phase (StrictMode might run it twice).

title: SuspenseList
explanation: Experimental/Available feature to coordinate loading sequence of multiple Suspense boundaries.

title: HOC returning same component
explanation:
HOC should return a new component (usually). Returning the input component directly mutates or is useless (no props injection). Not strictly an error, but 'bad pattern'. 
Error: `onClick={this.handleClick.bind(this)}` in render (perf).

title: Bind in render
explanation: Binding specific methods in render creates a new function every time, breaking memoization of child components.

title: Custom hook return
codeSnippet:
function useX() { return [1, 2]; }
// Must return array?
explanation: Hooks can return anything (array, object, value, null). Array is just convention.

title: Missing display name HOC
explanation: Returning anonymous class/function makes debugging hard. Should set displayName like `WithHOC(${getDisplayName(Comp)})`.

title: React.Children.map
explanation: Safe way to iterate children (handles null/single child/array).

title: Key boolean
explanation: Keys should be strings or numbers. Boolean is coerced to string 'true', which might work but is confusing.

title: UseReducer init lazy
explanation: useReducer supports a third argument for lazy initialization.

title: Unmounted state update
explanation: If api() resolves after unmount, setS called. React warns (used to). Proper fix: check 'm' flag.

title: Shallow copy state
explanation: Standard way to update object state immutably.

title: Context default value vs Provider
explanation: Provider missing value prop triggers error (it doesn't fallback to default value 1; default is ONLY used when no Provider is wrapping).

title: UseDeferredValue
explanation: Similar concept, but defers updates to keep UI responsive without fixed delay.

title: Invalid hook call loop 2
explanation: Hooks in loops.

title: Custom hook start with use
explanation: Linter enforces custom hooks start with 'use'.

title: Props default destructuring
explanation: Syntax error. Default value uses '=', not ':'. `{ a = 1 }`.

title: CloneElement
explanation: Way to modify props of a React Element.

title: UseEffect return null
explanation: Cleanup should be a function or undefined. 'null' is not strictly valid (though might be ignored in some versions, TypeScript complains).

title: Memo compare function
explanation: If compare function returns true, re-render is skipped.

title: SetState undefined
explanation:
Setting state to undefined is valid in JS, but might crash if code expects number. Technically valid code. 
Error: `style={{ color: 'red'; }}` (semicolon in object).

title: Style syntax error
explanation: Style object is a JS object. Semicolons are invalid separators.

title: Capture phase event
explanation: React supports capture phase listeners.

title: Async component
codeSnippet:
async function C() { return <div />; }
// Used as <C /> in client app
explanation: Standard (Client) React components cannot be async functions. Only RSC.

title: UseSyncExternalStore
explanation: Hook for subscribing to external stores compatible with concurrent rendering.

title: Ref on functional component
explanation: Cannot attach ref to functional component without forwardRef.

title: Key prop removal
codeSnippet: // Key prop is not accessible in child props?
explanation: React extracts 'key' (and ref) and does not pass them down.

title: UseState function call
explanation: calc() runs on every render. If expensive, use `useState(() => calc())`.

title: React.isValidElement
explanation: Checks if object is a React Element.

title: Wrong context usage
explanation: useContext expects the Context object itself `useContext(Ctx)`, not `Ctx.Consumer` OR `Ctx.Provider`.

title: SetState synchronous in legacy
codeSnippet: // setState used to be sync in event handlers?
explanation: setState has generally been async (batched) in event handlers. It was sync in setTimeout/native events in React 17-, but batched everywhere in 18.

title: Effect dependency constant
explanation: config is a new object every render. Effect runs every time. Move inside effect or memoize.

title: Component name capitalization
explanation: React treats lowercase tags as DOM tags (div, span). Components must be Capitalized.

title: Duplicate identifier hooks
codeSnippet:
const [a, setA] = useState(1);
const [a, setB] = useState(2);
explanation: Redeclaration of 'a'.

title: Empty fragment
explanation: Empty fragment shorthand is valid.

title: Class component no render
explanation: Class component must implement render().

title: Render props vs Hooks
codeSnippet: // Hooks allow reuse of stateful logic without hierarchy nesting?
explanation: Hooks solve the 'wrapper hell' of HOCs/Render Props.

title: Async useLayoutEffect
explanation: useLayoutEffect runs synchronously. Making it async returns a Promise, which delays nothing and breaks cleanup.

title: Use server directive
explanation: Marking a function as a Server Action.

title: Compound component context missing
explanation: Compound components usually require a Provider in the parent component to share state with children.

title: Automatic batching events
explanation: React 18 batches updates in native event listeners too.

title: Mutable ref in dependency
explanation: Mutating ref.current doesn't trigger effect re-run. Watching ref.current is usually a bug or requires callback ref.

title: Suspense fallbacks
explanation: Fallback can be null.

title: Invalid hook dependency type
explanation: Dependency array must be an array, not a primitive string.

title: Server Context
explanation: Experimental API to share data in Server Components (limited support/deprecated in favor of other patterns, but technically exists in builds).

title: Memoized component props mismatch
codeSnippet:
const C = React.memo(({ obj }) => <div />);
// Usage: <C obj={{a:1}} /> (new object every time)
explanation: Passing a new object reference defeats React.memo optimization. Prop will always be different shallowly.

title: UseOptimistic
explanation: Hook for managing optimistic UI updates (experimental/canary -> stable).

title: Hook conditionally executed
explanation: Hooks cannot be conditional (Ternary implies ordering change or different hook calls).

title: Cache API
codeSnippet:
import { cache } from 'react';
const getUser = cache(async (id) => ...);
explanation: 'cache' allows deduping data requests in Server Components per request.

title: Unsafe life cycle
explanation: componentWillMount is deprecated/unsafe. Use componentDidMount or constructor.

title: Key prefixing
explanation: Prefixing keys is fine if ID is unique. Sometimes helps readability.

title: Double provider
explanation: Inner provider overrides outer. Not an error to code, but logic error if expecting '1'. Consumer sees 2.

title: UseFormStatus
explanation: Hook to access form submission status in children of <form>.

title: Text inside table
explanation: Text content directly inside <table> is invalid HTML (ignored/moved). Must be in td/th/caption.

title: Prop drill vs Composition
codeSnippet:
<Layout header={<Header user={user} />} />
// Avoids passing 'user' through Layout?
explanation: Component composition (passing components as props) is a valid alternative to context for avoiding prop drilling.

title: State mutation array push
explanation: Mutating array 'push' and setting same reference does not trigger re-render. Use `setList([...list, 1])`.

title: Tearing
explanation: It ensures the UI shows a consistent version of external store data during concurrent rendering.

title: Invalid style property
explanation: Specific style properties must be camelCase: `backgroundColor`.

title: Client Component boundaries
codeSnippet: // Importing Server Component into Client Component works?
explanation: You cannot import a Server Component directly into a Client Component (unless passed as children/props).

title: Accessing state after set
explanation: State variable 'count' still holds the value from the render when the function was created (closure). setState doesn't update local 'count' variable immediately.

title: UseEffect cleanup mount
codeSnippet: // Cleanup runs on unmount AND before re-running effect?
explanation: Cleanup function runs to clean up previous effect before applying next one.

title: Ref callback null
explanation: Ref callback is called with 'null' on unmount/update. `el.focus()` will crash when el is null. Check `if (el)`.

title: Profiler API
explanation: Profiler component measures rendering performance.

title: Component as prop naming
explanation: JSX requires capitalized tag for components. `<Icon />` (renamed in destructuring) is correct, but `<icon />` looks like a DOM tag.

title: UseActionState
explanation: Latest hook name for handling form actions (renamed from useFormState).

title: UseState in loop 2
explanation: Hooks cannot be called inside a callback (map). Extract to a child component.

title: Strict Mode production
codeSnippet: // Strict Mode checks run in production?
explanation: Strict Mode checks (double render, etc.) are development only.

title: String prop braces
explanation:
Not an error, just verbose. `<C val="text" />` is cleaner. 
Error: `<C val="{text}" />` (passes string "{text}", not variable).

title: String interpolation in prop
explanation: This passes the literal string "Count: {count}". Use curly braces: `val={`Count: ${count}`}`.

title: Context undefined check
codeSnippet: if (ctx === undefined) throw new Error('Missing Provider');
explanation: Common pattern in custom context hooks to enforce provider usage.

title: Hook order variable
explanation: If 'x' changes, the number of hooks changes, shifting the order of subsequent hooks.

title: Hydration mismatch
explanation: React warns/errors if server HTML doesn't match initial client render.

title: Invalid event handler name
explanation: React events are camelCase: `onClick`.

title: UseTransition isPending
explanation: isPending allows showing loading state during a transition.

title: Ref cleanup return
explanation: useImperativeHandle expects a factory function returning the handle object, not a cleanup function (it's not useEffect).

title: Portal context access
codeSnippet: // Child in Portal can access Context from Parent?
explanation: Portals exist in the React tree, so context propagates down to them.

title: SetState invalid value
explanation: Assignment 's=1' returns 1, so state updates to 1. But mutating 's' (const) throws error. If 'let s', it works but is weird style.

title: Class contextType
explanation: Simplest way to consume one context in class components.

title: UseEffect object dependency
explanation: Array literal dependency `[1,2]` is new every render. Effect runs constantly.

title: Component returning Array
explanation: Components can return arrays of elements.

title: Hook conditionally called
explanation: Code after return is unreachable. Logic error? Also hooks usually before return.

title: Lazy load Error Boundary
codeSnippet: // Lazy components need ErrorBoundary for network failure?
explanation: If the chunk fails to load, it throws an error handled by ErrorBoundary.

title: Double render method
explanation: Duplicate method declaration. Last one wins.

title: UseMemo void dependency
explanation: Empty array means runs once (and memoizes result forever).

title: Props modification
explanation: Props objects are frozen/read-only.

title: FindDOMNode deprecated
explanation: findDOMNode is deprecated.

title: Invalid tag nesting p div
explanation:
Invalid HTML:

cannot contain block elements like

. React ensures hydration mismatch warnings (or browser fixes it).

title: Ref generic type
explanation: Standard TypeScript syntax for Refs.

title: Suspense without fallback
explanation: Suspense component requires a 'fallback' prop (even if null).

title: UseLayoutEffect Server
explanation: It warns because it cannot run on the server (no DOM).

title: Key duplicate in array
explanation: Duplicate keys in array.

title: Hydration error suppression
explanation: Attribute to suppress mismatch warnings (e.g. for timestamps).

title: SetState circular dependency
explanation: Missing dependency array results in infinite loop (render -> effect -> setS -> render).

title: Fiber reconciliation
explanation: Fiber architecture enables splitting rendering work into chunks.

title: Invalid hook call nested if
explanation: Hooks must be called at top level.

title: Context.displayName
explanation: Sets the name shown in React DevTools.

title: Ref forward missing
codeSnippet:
const Child = (props, ref) => <div ref={ref} />;
// Usage: <Child ref={r} />
explanation: Child is not wrapped in forwardRef, so second argument 'ref' is undefined (or invalid prop).

title: Act testing wrapper
explanation: The 'act' helper ensures updates are processed before assertions (simulates browser behavior).

title: Children prop overwrite
explanation: 'B' are passed as 'children'. The prop `children="A"` is redundant or conflicting. React usually prefers the nested content 'B'.

title: Render phase pure
codeSnippet: // Render phase must be pure/side-effect free?
explanation: Side effects belong in commit phase (useEffect, etc.). Render phase is for calculating UI.

title: Invalid style value
explanation: String '100' is invalid CSS width (missing unit). Numbers get 'px', strings need explicit unit '100px'.

title: Keys local scope
explanation: Keys only need to be unique among siblings.

title: Invalid hook call callback
explanation: Hooks inside event handler (regular function) is invalid. Must be top-level component.

title: UseReducer dispatch identity
explanation: Dispatch function identity is stable across renders.

title: Returning object from component
explanation: Components must return React Elements (JSX, createElement result) or null. A plain JS object `{type:'div'}` is not a valid Element unless it's a valid Fiber node/element structure (missing $$typeof, props etc).

title: Lazy import default
explanation: React.lazy expects the Promise to resolve to a module with a 'default' export.

title: UseEffect cleanup void (2)
explanation: If 'cleanup()' returns undefined, it's fine. If it returns something else, React warns. The intention is probably `return cleanup`.

title: React.startTransition
explanation: Marks the update as a transition (low priority).

title: Context consumer nesting gap
explanation: Function child in Consumer must return a React Node. If 'v' is object, error.

title: Custom hook sharing state
codeSnippet: // Two components using useCounter() share the same count state?
explanation: Hooks reuse stateful LOGIC, not state itself. Each component gets its own state.

title: State mismatch type
explanation: TypeScript would catch this. In JS, it works but is likely a bug (string vs number math).

title: Components inside map key
explanation: Correct usage of keys.

title: Prop spreading key
explanation:
Spreading object with 'key' works in JSX (React extracts it). Not an error technically, but 'key' is special. Wait, in older React, spread key might not work? In modern React, `<div {...props} />` where props has key IS valid and applies the key. 
Error: `onClick={this.click}` in function component.

title: This in function component
explanation: 'this' is undefined in function components (unless attached to window/global scope in loose mode).

title: UseRef initialization
explanation: The argument to useRef is evaluated on every render (though result is ignored after mount). Use lazy pattern `useRef(null)` and init in effect if expensive.

title: Ref forward usage
explanation: forwardRef function must accept 2 arguments (props, ref).

title: React.StrictMode
explanation: Yes, to ensure they are pure.

title: Invalid React.lazy usage
explanation: React.lazy expects a function returning a Promise (dynamic import), not a JSX element.

title: UseState batching async
explanation: React 17 does NOT batch inside async functions/promises. React 18 does.

title: Default export forwardRef
codeSnippet:
export default forwardRef(...) 
// component name in DevTools?
explanation: Anonymous forwardRef components show up as 'ForwardRef' in DevTools. Better to name the function or assign to variable.

title: React.Fragment short syntax
explanation: Short syntax `<>` cannot accept props/keys. Must use `<React.Fragment>`.

title: Array modification state
explanation: Mutating state directly and setting same ref.

title: CreateContext default
explanation: Default value is used when consumer has no matching Provider above it.

title: Effect clean up return value
explanation: Effect returned 1. Should return function or undefined.

title: React.Children.count
explanation: Counts children strictly (flattening arrays).

title: Rendering Date object
explanation: Objects (Date) are not valid children. Must convert to string `.toString()`.

title: UseReducer third arg
explanation: Third argument is initializer function.

title: Hook call expression
explanation:
Hooks must be top-level statements, not part of expressions (sometimes tricky lint rule). Actually, `const [x] = useState(0) || []` is valid syntax, but logically weird. 
Error: `const state = useState(0); console.log(state.count);` (state is array).

title: UseState return access
explanation: useState returns `[value, setter]`. Accessing property `.value` is undefined. Use `state[0]`.

title: Shallow Compare props
codeSnippet: // React.memo uses strict equality on props?
explanation: React.memo uses shallow comparison (shallowEqual).

title: Component definition inside component
explanation: Defining Child inside Parent creates a new component type every render. Child will remount/lose state every time. Move Child outside.

title: Multiple roots
codeSnippet: // React 18 allows createRoot on multiple containers?
explanation: Yes, you can have multiple separate React roots.

title: Infinite update loop useEffect
explanation: Updates val -> triggers effect -> updates val. Infinite loop (unless condition breaks it, but here val+1 implies growing).

title: Ref passed as prop
explanation: Passing ref as a custom prop (e.g. innerRef) is a valid pattern to avoid forwardRef.

title: Context provider value inline object
explanation: Creating object in render causes all consumers to re-render. Performance issue (often flagged as 'error' in strict codebases).

title: React.PureComponent deep compare
explanation: It does shallow comparison.

title: Key duplicate literal
explanation: Duplicate keys.

title: UseInsertionEffect
explanation: Hook for CSS-in-JS libraries to inject styles before layout.

title: Invalid Hook call class method
explanation: Hooks cannot be used in class components.

title: Portals event propagation
codeSnippet: // Events propagate from portal to host DOM parent?
explanation: Props propagate to React parent, not Host DOM parent (unless they coincide).

title: UseEffect missing dependency function
explanation: doStf depends on 'prop', but is not in dependency array. Closure captures old prop. Either move doStf inside effect, or add to deps (and wrap doStf in useCallback).

title: Suspense data fetching
explanation: Suspense only works with Suspense-enabled data sources (frameworks, or use() hook), not arbitrary promises in useEffect.

title: State update on unmounted
explanation: Potential memory leak/warning if unmounted before 1s. Should return cleanup `clearTimeout(id)`.

title: React.startTransition async
explanation: startTransition expects a synchronous callback. Async transitions are for useTransition (which returns pending state). Wait, startTransition callback *must* be synchronous in React 18.2.

title: Custom hook name lowercase
explanation: Linter assumes it's a regular function so 'useState' call is invalid. Must start with 'use'.

title: Use hook (React 19)
explanation: 'use' hook unwraps promises (suspends if pending) and contexts. Valid in React Canary/19.

title: Duplicate keys table row
explanation: Not an error (keys in different scopes). `tr` key is for map, `td` key is for td list (if multiple). If single td, key not needed but valid.

title: Duplicate keys separate arrays
explanation: If list1 and list2 have overlapping IDs, we have duplicate keys among siblings (li) in the parent div. Need prefix.

title: Server Actions form action
explanation: React extends <form> to accept functions (Server Actions) in 'action' prop.

title: Invalid hook call in class
explanation: Hooks cannot be used in class constructor.

title: Hydration suppress attribute
explanation: Valid attribute to suppress warnings for contentEditable elements.

title: Context provider value mutations
explanation: Mutating the value object locally doesn't trigger re-render of Provider consumers unless the component re-renders with new value prop.

title: Ref callback cleanup
explanation: Ref callbacks (in older React) did not support cleanup functions. (Wait, React 19 might? Or was it always no? Traditionally NO, it calls with null. React 19 introduces cleanup support for ref callbacks). Assuming standard React 18: False.

title: Useless useMemo
explanation: Memoizing a primitive constant '5' is unnecessary overhead.

title: Offscreen component
explanation: Experimental/Internal component for hiding subtrees while keeping state active (used by Suspense/Router).

title: Invalid hook dependency function
explanation: handle is created every render. Effect runs every render. Use useCallback for the function.

title: UseOptimistic returns
explanation: Returns [optimisticState, addOptimistic].

title: Directly modifying DOM ref
explanation: Modifying innerHTML controlled by React can cause hydration mismatches or losing React event listeners. Use DangerouslySetInnerHTML or React children.

title: Key boolean cast
explanation: React casts non-string keys to strings.

title: UseContext in loop
explanation: Hooks cannot be called in loops.

title: React.memo second arg
explanation: Function for custom comparison.

title: SetState closure staleness
explanation: 'inc' captures initial count. setInterval keeps calling initial 'inc'.

title: Error Boundary event handlers
codeSnippet: // ErrorBoundary catches errors in event handlers?
explanation: Error Boundaries do NOT catch errors in event handlers (use try/catch there). They catch render/lifecycle errors.

title: Component name lower (2)
explanation: Lowercase component name interpreted as built-in tag.

title: Ref unmount null
codeSnippet: // Ref callback called with null on unmount?
explanation: Yes, to allows cleaning up.

title: Effect missing dep object prop
explanation: props.a is missing from dependencies.

title: Style !important
explanation: React supports string values with !important (though discouraged).

title: Conditional hook count change
explanation: Number of hooks called must be constant across renders.

title: UseId unique per root
codeSnippet: // useId() unique across multiple React roots?
explanation: useId uses a tree-based counter (useIdIdentifier). If you have multiple roots, they might generate collision if strict prefixes aren't used/configured. (Actually useId includes a random root identifier? No, usually `:r1:`. Multiple roots need configured identifierPrefix). false.

title: SetState promise
explanation: setState does not unwrap promises. State becomes the Promise object.

title: Hydration event replay
codeSnippet: // React 18 replays events that happened before hydration?
explanation: Yes, React records events on the root and replays them once hydration completes.

title: Invalid aria prop
explanation: ARIA attributes should be strings.

title: SetState identical value
explanation: React bails out (skips render) if the new state is identical (Object.is) to the current state.

title: Array key duplicate (2)
explanation: Duplicate keys.

title: UseTransition synchronous
explanation: Updates in startTransition are marked as transitions (lower priority, interruptible).

title: Direct prop write
explanation: Props are read-only.

title: UseEffect before paint
explanation: useEffect runs asynchronously after paint. useLayoutEffect blocks paint.

title: SetState function arg
explanation: Postfix operator 'count++' increments local variable but returns *original* value. State won't change if count=0-> return 0. Use `count + 1`.

title: React.cloneElement key preservation
explanation: Yes, unless overridden.

title: UseRef as state
codeSnippet:
const ref = useRef(0);
return <button onClick={() => ref.current++}>{ref.current}</button>;
explanation: Updating ref doesn't re-render. Button click changes value but UI stays old.

title: Custom hook rules
explanation: Custom hooks must follow rules of hooks (no conditional calls).

title: Async in render
explanation: Client components cannot be async.

title: SetState functional safe
codeSnippet:
setCount(c => c + 1);
// Safe in concurrent updates?
explanation: Functional updates are safer for batched/concurrent validations as they use the pending state.

title: Boolean prop true
explanation: String "true" is truthy, but boolean props like 'required' work best as `<input required />` or `<input required={true} />`. Some versions warn on string 'true'.

title: SyntheticEvent persistence
explanation: React 16 pooled events, needing persist() for async access. 17 removed pooling.

title: UseEffect infinite loop obj
codeSnippet:
useEffect(() => setObj({}), []); // safe
useEffect(() => setObj({}), [obj]); // loop
explanation: Setting a new object `{}` creates a new reference, triggering the dependency `[obj]`, infinite loop.

title: UseId formatting
explanation: Generated IDs typically look like `:r0:`.

title: Invalid style px
explanation:
Valid (adds px). error: `<div style={{ flex: 1 }} />` (unitless). Wait, invalid one? 
Error: `<div style="width:100px" />`.

title: Style string
explanation: Style prop must be an object.

title: Server Action args
codeSnippet: // Server Actions receive FormData as first arg (in form)?
explanation: When used in `action` prop, valid.

title: Duplicate ref key
explanation: Duplicate prop 'ref'. Only the last one will be used. Cannot attach two refs this way (need mergeRefs).

title: UseEffect strict mode mount
codeSnippet: // Strict Mode mounts, unmounts, mounts components?
explanation: This behavior helps identify effects needing cleanup.

title: Context consumer render
explanation: Consumer requires a function as child.

title: Lazy lazy
codeSnippet:
lazy(() => import('./C'));
// Promise must resolve to { default: Component }?
explanation: Standard requirement.

title: Wrong use of use
explanation: Wait. `use` is the ONLY hook that CAN be called conditionally (in loops/ifs). So this is NOT an error in React 19.

title: Use in class
explanation: `use` is a Hook (sort of), can only be used in render of function components (or hooks).

title: Use conditional
explanation: `use` API supports conditional usage.

title: ForwardRef type param
explanation: In TypeScript, forwardRef generic args are `<RefType, PropsType>`. Swapping them is a common error (`<Props, Ref>`). In JS, it's valid.

title: Invalid memo compare
explanation:
Returns false -> always re-render. Not an error, just de-optimization. 
Error: `useEffect(async () => ...)`.

title: UseEffect paint blocking
explanation: Standard behavior to avoid blocking UI.

title: Hook assignment
explanation:
Not an error syntax-wise. Just weird. 
Error: `const { state, setState } = useState(0)` (destructuring object instead of array).

title: Hook object destructure
explanation: useState returns an array `[value, setter]`. Object destructuring fails.

title: Profiler actualDuration
explanation: Yes, time spent rendering the commit.

title: SetState inside render
explanation: Updating state during render IS allowed for the SAME component (to essentially derive state/restart render), but must be conditional and finite to avoid infinite loops. Unrestricted setVal causes infinite loop.

title: React.StrictMode unmount
explanation: Stress tests effects.
